meanings.definition: Relating to or consisting of microtubules.
meanings.sent1: The scientist observed the microtubular structure under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The microtubular fibers provided support to the cell.
meanings.sent3: The microtubular assembly looked like a tiny highway system.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts moved along the microtubular paths of her mind.
meanings.sent5: The microtubular pattern was as intricate as a spider's web.

meanings.sent1: The microtubular shape of the toy reminded him of a tiny tunnel.
meanings.sent2: Her hair had a microtubular appearance after using the new shampoo.
meanings.sent3: The microtubular design on the dress made her look like a futuristic princess.
meanings.sent4: His voice echoed through the room, sounding microtubular.
meanings.sent5: The microtubular shadows danced on the wall like elongated ghosts.
